title: Watch: In a first, India uses laser weapon to shoot down aircraft, drones
content: India has achieved a significant milestone in defense technology with the successful demonstration of a 30-kilowatt laser weapon system capable of neutralizing aerial threats like drones and missiles. Developed by the DRDO, this directed-energy weapon is ready for production and deployment, placing India among a select group of nations with advanced laser capabilities.

title: When will India get 5th-generation stealth fighter? DRDO chief answers
content: India is poised to receive its first fifth-generation stealth fighter jet, the AMCA, by 2035, as announced by DRDO chairman Samir V Kamat. DRDO is also planning to collaborate with a foreign OEM for aero-engine development. Furthermore, DRDO demonstrated its laser-based weapon system capable of neutralizing aerial threats, joining an elite group of nations with such capabilities.

title: Watch: Waqf law protesters clash with police in Assam's Silchar
content: In Silchar, Assam, a clash erupted on Sunday between police and demonstrators protesting the Waqf (Amendment) Act. Hundreds gathered in Berenga, blocking roads and allegedly throwing stones, prompting a baton charge by police to disperse the unauthorized protest.

title: When Steve Jobs explained to Barack Obama why iPhones can’t be made in US
content: Amidst Trump's push for US manufacturing, Apple faces pressure to shift iPhone production domestically. Despite a commitment to invest in the US, Apple's past CEO, Steve Jobs, cited scale, speed, and specialized skills as reasons for manufacturing in China. To mitigate potential tariff impacts, Apple expedited iPhone shipments from India to China.

title: After meet with Amit Shah, Shinde rebuffs rift within Mahayuti
content: Maharashtra's Deputy CM Eknath Shinde dismissed rumors of discord within the Mahayuti alliance, clarifying his meeting with Union Minister Amit Shah focused on state development projects. Speculation arose after appointments of guardian ministers and concerns over ministry files and reversed decisions. The BJP defended Shinde, stating he would address issues directly with Deputy CM Ajit Pawar.

title: 'Forced to drink alcohol, strangled': UP woman killed over property
content: In Etawah, police arrested two individuals for the murder of a woman who had invested in a property through one of the accused. When she requested her money back, the property dealer and his accomplice allegedly lured her, intoxicated her, and strangled her. The perpetrators disposed of the body in the Yamuna River and destroyed her scooter.

title: When LinkedIn co-founder said: Go home, have dinner, then open laptops...
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman believes a relentless work ethic is essential for startup success, even if it means sacrificing work-life balance. He suggests employees should continue working after family dinner, a stance he defends by highlighting the financial rewards for early employees. Hoffman argues that those prioritizing balance misunderstand the intense nature of the startup game.

title: 'Do you have ties with Pak?': Punjab CM attacks Cong MLA over '50 bombs' remark
content: A controversy has erupted in Punjab after Congress leader Partap Singh Bajwa claimed that 50 bombs had reached the state, with 18 already exploded. Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann demanded Bajwa reveal his source, questioning if he had ties to Pakistan.

title: Mother gets death sentence for 'ritual sacrifice' of 7-month-old baby
content: In a shocking verdict, a Suryapet court sentenced B Bharathi to death for the 2021 ritualistic murder of her infant daughter. Bharathi sacrificed her child to supposedly eliminate her 'sarpa dosham,' an astrological belief. This conviction was influenced by her prior imprisonment for assaulting her husband with a stone.

title: Pakistan Super League team announces powerful gesture for Palestine
content: Multan Sultans, a team in the Pakistan Super League, has launched a charitable campaign to support Palestinian charities. The team pledges to donate Rs 100,000 for every six hit and every wicket taken by their players during the PSL season. The league commenced with exciting matches, including Quetta Gladiators' victory and Karachi Kings' successful pursuit of Multan Sultans' score.

title: US: We will Revoke or Deny Visa if your Facebook, Twitter posts are in Support of ...
content: USCIS has officially declared that social media posts, particularly those deemed anti-Semitic or supportive of designated terrorist groups like Hamas and Hezbollah, can lead to US visa rejection or revocation. This policy, effective immediately, impacts student visas and Green Card applications. The Trump administration, through Secretary of State Marco Rubio, has already revoked visas of hundreds of international students.

title: 8 dead, 7 injured in explosion at firecracker unit in Andhra Pradesh
content: A devastating explosion at a firecracker manufacturing unit in Anakapalle district's Kailasapatnam village has claimed the lives of eight individuals and left seven others injured. The incident occurred on Sunday afternoon, igniting a massive fire that engulfed the entire unit.

title: Milwaukee Bucks vs Detroit Pistons final injury report
content: Milwaukee Bucks will rest key players for the game against Detroit Pistons. Giannis Antetokounmpo is doubtful due to a shoulder issue. Damian Lillard and Brook Lopez are also out. The Bucks have already secured a playoff spot. The team wants to ensure players are healthy for the postseason. The game will give bench players a chance to play.

title: Five-year-old girl killed in Hubballi, five teams formed to trace accused
content: The girl’s parents told the police that an unidentified person had abducted the girl, probably when the mother was at work, and killed her.

title: Protesters hurl stones, police lathi charge in clash during anti-Waqf Act agitation in Assam’s Silchar
content: The protesters showed black flags and shouted slogans against the BJP government, demanding repeal of the Act

title: Russia ‘deliberately’ targeted Indian pharma company’s warehouse in Kyiv: Ukrainian Embassy
content: Kusum Healthcare’s representative in Sumy said the main warehouse had been completely destroyed in the attack, while the factory remained fully operational

title: Around 20% posts lying vacant across departments in Kashmir University, reveals RTI reply
content: The application filed by Jammu-based RTI activist Raman Kumar Sharma in February 2025 revealed that majority of the vacancies are at the faculty level

title: Fire at labourers’ colony in Bengaluru guts 40 sheds
content: Residents of the colony are employed in a toy factory and are daily wagers from other parts of the State; no injuries were reported.

title: 17,900 women assisted in Karnataka’s Sakhi centres but activists flag inadequacy of resources
content: The One Stop Centres get anywhere between 10-30 cases a month; most women need medical or legal help due to domestic abuse, are victims of POCSO cases and those who need counselling and rehabilitation.

title: PM Modi to launch development projects in Haryana on Ambedkar birth anniversary
content: PM Modi to launch development initiatives in Haryana, including new airport terminal, power unit, and biogas plant

title: 3-year-old boy dies after being bitten by rabid dog in Uttar Pradesh
content: His death led to the revelation that around 10 other children were also attacked by the same rabid dog. Following this, a team of health officials rushed to the village on Friday

title: BJP files complaint against Kanhaiya Kumar for making ‘abusive’ remarks on RSS, PM Modi
content: A delegation led by the BJP's media in-charge in Bihar, Danish Iqbal, visited the Kotwali police station and filed the complaint.

title: Indian family undergoing rapid change, impacting law and society: SC Judge B. V. Nagarathna
content: Justice Nagarathna opined that a significant percentage of the family disputes that are currently lying with the courts in India would be resolved if both parties take two steps

title: SC dismisses adoption deed in property dispute, says meant to oust daughters from rightful inheritance
content: The high court, which also apologised for over four decades of delay in deciding the question of the validity of the adoption deed filed in 1983, also said that the mandatory requirement that a person who adopts a child must have the consent of his wife was absent

title: Himanta meets Jeet Adani, discusses implementation of ₹50,000 crore investment proposals in Assam
content: “We expect the MoUs which we signed related to significant investments in developing an aero-city, hotels, cement plant and key infrastructure projects, will take off soon,” the CM said

title: Kancha Gachibowli row: Research scholar arrested for attacking police officials gets bail
content: Naveen Erram was granted bail in a case related to students’ protest against the auction of 400-acre land in Kancha Gachibowli; the other student who was detained, identified as B. Rohit Kumar, has not been released, the police said

title: Kerala HC lawyer accused in rape case found hanging
content: Kerala High Court lawyer P G Manu, recently granted bail in an alleged rape case, was found dead in Kollam. Police suspect suicide at his rented accommodation after junior advocates discovered him. Manu, previously a senior government pleader and NIA counsel, faced accusations of sexually assaulting a client, leading to his resignation last year.

title: Bihar BJP files police complaint against Kanhaiya Kumar for remarks on PM Modi, RSS
content: The BJP's Bihar unit has lodged a police complaint against Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar in Patna, alleging he used offensive language against Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the RSS during a recent television interview. The complaint, filed by a BJP delegation, seeks an FIR against Kumar for his remarks made on April 11, deeming them objectionable and unacceptable.

title: At least 31 killed as Russian missiles strike Ukraine; Zelenskyy shares video
content: A devastating Russian ballistic missile strike on Sumy, Ukraine, resulted in over 31 fatalities and 83 injuries, including children, on Palm Sunday. President Zelenskyy shared a horrific video of the aftermath, showing widespread destruction and casualties, and urgently appealed to the world for a firm response. The video showed several dead bodies and injured being rescued, cars engulfed in flames and the street littered with debris—shards of glass, pieces of concrete, and tree branches thrown by the explosion.

title: Vinesh Phogat hits out at 'Rs 2 tweeters': 'Zip it, sit in the corner... and cry'
content: Wrestler-turned-politician Vinesh Phogat, disqualified from the Paris Olympics, had accepted a Rs 4 crore cash prize from the Haryana government, equivalent to an Olympic silver medallist's benefits. Phogat, now a Congress MLA, chose the cash award over other options like a government job or land plot. She has hit out at social media trolls for

title: 'People rushed out of buildings': Witnesses on fresh Myanmar quake
content: A 5.5 magnitude earthquake struck central Myanmar early Sunday, causing residents to flee their homes near the epicenter. This tremor follows a devastating 7.7-magnitude earthquake on March 28, which killed thousands and exacerbated the country's humanitarian crisis. The recent quake shook buildings and damaged ceilings, adding to the challenges faced by a nation already grappling with conflict and displacement.

title: IPL: Why are RCB wearing green jersey against Rajasthan Royals?
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru played Rajasthan Royals wearing green jerseys. This promoted environmental sustainability. Rajat Patidar chose to bowl first after winning the toss. The green kit is part of RCB's "Go Green" initiative. It raises awareness about conservation. The jersey is made from recycled polyester. RCB is a carbon-neutral franchise. They monitor emissions from various sources.

title: Hardik Pandya's priceless '1100g gift' to young cricketer
content: Hardik Pandya fulfilled his promise to Kashvee Gautam, gifting her a customized bat weighing 1100 grams. He presented the bat before Mumbai Indians' clash against Delhi Capitals, congratulating her on her first call-up to the Indian team following a stellar WPL season with Gujarat Giants. Pandya encouraged her to play well and represent India.

title: Shardul hits back at commentators: 'It's easy to sit and comment'
content: Shardul Thakur has defended bowlers against criticism from commentators, emphasising the increasing prevalence of high scores in modern cricket. He highlighted the team's successful defense of scores despite missing key players, attributing their success to nerve and belief. Thakur also suggested commentators should review their own records before criticising players.

title: 'Govt won't take hasty decision': DK Shivakumar on Karnataka caste census report
content: Karnataka's Deputy CM, DK Shivakumar, has stated that the state government will not make any hasty decisions regarding the 'caste census' report. The report, which was recently presented to the cabinet, suggests increasing the OBC quota to 51%. Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge refrained from commenting until he reviews the report, while dominant communities express reservations about the survey.

title: Man accused of raping and killing minor girl found dead in Navi Mumbai jail
content: Vishal Gawli, a 35-year-old undertrial accused of the rape and murder of a 13-year-old girl, died by suicide at Taloja jail. He hanged himself in the toilet using a towel. Gawli was arrested last December along with his wife, Sakshi, who is accused of helping him dispose of the victim's body and is currently held at Byculla jail.

title: 7 years after pulling out, why is Trump re-engaging Iran on nuclear deal?
content: Iran is not allowed to have nuclear weapons because it is a member of the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT), which it signed along with most other countries. This agreement allows countries to use nuclear technology only for peaceful purposes, like energy, medicine, and agriculture. It strictly prohibits the development of nuclear weapons.

title: Murshidabad violence: Over 150 arrested, BJP claims Hindus 'forced to flee'
content: Following unrest in Murshidabad, West Bengal, triggered by the amended Waqf law, authorities have arrested over 150 individuals and deployed BSF forces to restore peace. The Calcutta HC mandated the deployment after violence erupted, resulting in three deaths and widespread unrest across several districts. Political tensions escalate as BJP criticises Mamata Banerjee's government.

title: City lights and stars: Nasa shares nighttime image of India from space
content: Nasa released stunning nighttime images from the International Space Station, showcasing illuminated regions across the globe. One captivating photograph features India, glowing with city lights under a starlit sky. The series also includes views of the cloud-covered Midwest United States, Southeast Asia, and Canada with a faint green aurora, sparking social media appreciation.

title: CEO's 'end of days' warning as Trump’s tariff shock on China sparks panic
content: American importers are reeling from President Trump's sudden tariff hike on Chinese goods, with some fearing devastating consequences. Companies like Learning Resources and MGA Entertainment face soaring costs, potentially leading to price increases, production cuts, and even layoffs. The unpredictable tariffs threaten supply chains and could trigger inflation, impacting US economic growth and consumer sentiment.

title: Viral video: New Zealand tourist coaxed to say swear words in Marathi
content: Haveli police have registered a case against four unidentified youths from Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar after a video went viral showing them tricking a New Zealand national into uttering Marathi swear words. The incident took place at Sinhagad Fort near Pune, where the youths engaged the foreigner in conversation and encouraged him to repeat obscene phrases without his knowledge.

title: Watch: Nicholas Pooran's six sends spectator to hospital!
content: In an electrifying IPL double-header, Nicholas Pooran's explosive 61 off 34 propelled Lucknow Super Giants to victory against Gujarat Titans, though one of his sixes unfortunately injured a spectator. With the win, LSG moved themselves to third in the IPL points table while GT dropped to second place.

title: NIA probes Dawood link in 26/11 plot through Tahawwur Rana interrogation
content: The NIA is intensifying its investigation into Tahawwur Rana's role in the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, scrutinizing his connections to a Dubai-based individual potentially linked to Dawood Ibrahim's D-Company. Investigators are analysing phone calls between Rana and Headley, exploring possible ISI and LeT ties, and examining Rana's pre-attack visits to India.

title: Stage set for the launch pilot project of Bhu Bharati portal on April 14
content: Rules and guidelines for operation of the portal, replacing Dharani, finalised after three months exercise

title: DSP transferred, 11 police officers of Guntur district suspended in Gorantla Madhav issue
content: Action was taken against the police personnel on charges of negligence in discharging their duties, the officials said

title: All set for Kumbhotsavam of Goddess Bhramaramba in Srisailam
content: Executive Officer directs all departments to ensure no slaughter or killing of animals occurs in the temple town on that day

title: Chandrababu expresses shock over road accident in Sri Sathya Sai district
content: He was deeply saddened by the death of three women after an unidentified vehicle hit their auto near Dhanapuram in Parigi mandal

title: 40 trees felled in Mysuru for road widening sparking outrage among activists
content: Deputy Conservator of Forest Dr. K.N. Basavaraj, said Mysuru City Corporation will have to compensate with 10 saplings per tree felled, and hence 400 saplings will be planted as compensatory afforestation.

title: 3 women killed, 6 hurt in road mishap near Hindupur
content: The share-auto carrying passengers, returning after a darshan at temple of Goddess Chowdeswari at Kotipi, was trying to enter the National Highway from a rural road  when the accident occurred

title: Union Civil Aviation Minister urged to revive flights to abroad and several cities of India
content: Tours and Travels Association of Andhra chairman O. Naresh submitted a representation to Union Civil Aviation Minister in Srikakulam and sought direct flights for other international cities

title: Seven from undivided Kurnool and Anantapur districts make their way to YSRCP’s PAC
content: YSRCP State Coordinator Sajjala Ramakrishna Reddy has been appointed as the Coordinator of the Political Advisory Committee

title: IPL 2025: Railing along Cubbon Road in Bengaluru inconvenience to pedestrians
content: The railing, erected by the Bengaluru Traffic Police for the safety of cricket enthusiasts and to ensure match-goers do not walk on the road leading to traffic congestion, is obstructing the movement of pedestrians who are now unable to step onto the footpath.

title: BJP MP urges Centre to declare four West Bengal districts as 'Disturbed Areas' under AFSPA
content: BJP’s Purulia MP alleged that districts such as Murshidabad, Malda, Nadia and South 24 Parganas have witnessed violence against Hindus, with the State administration turning a ‘blind eye’

title: Two operatives of terror module held with IED containing RDX: Punjab Police
content: The DGP said that a 2.8 kg IED containing 1.6 kg RDX and a remote control have been recovered from them

title: Case against IPS officer for raping doctor under pretext of marriage
content: According to the complainant, she and the man got in touch through the social media platform Instagram in November 2022, an official said

title: BJP targets Yusuf Pathan over 'good chai' post amid Murshidabad violence
content: BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla criticized TMC MP Yusuf Pathan for his relaxed social media post amidst violent unrest in West Bengal, particularly in Murshidabad. Poonawalla accused Pathan and TMC of prioritizing personal enjoyment over addressing the state's crisis, where Hindus are allegedly targeted.

title: Superstition busted! Abhishek's parents revel in son's historic six-fest
content: Arshdeep Singh playfully sought blessings from Abhishek Sharma's parents after the SRH batter's explosive 141 against his team. Sharma's father, previously superstitious about watching live, witnessed his son's remarkable innings, spurred by his mother's presence at the match. Yuvraj Singh humorously acknowledged Sharma's newfound maturity in taking singles to reach his century, marking a significant shift in his approach to batting.

title: Trump wants to halt climate research by key agency: Reports
content: The Trump administration, pursuing its deeply skeptical approach to climate change, wants to severely cut back the research arm of a government agency that plays a pivotal role in global climate science, US media reported Friday. The White House also wants to make budget cuts to a branch of NASA that is tasked with using satellites to study and monitor the effects of climate change, according to media reports.

title: Kolkata maid caught dancing in stolen gold on YouTube
content: In Kolkata, a Behala family discovered their former maidservant, Purnima Mondal, had stolen gold ornaments after spotting her wearing them in YouTube Shorts. Sanchita Mukherjee, the employer, recognized her jewelry in the videos and alerted the Parnasree police. Mondal was arrested, and the stolen items were recovered.

title: Trump breaks out signature dance at UFC event, leaves netizens in splits
content: Donald Trump's appearance at UFC 314 in Miami sparked viral attention as he performed his signature dance upon entering the arena. The crowd cheered as Trump was accompanied by UFC President Dana White, his granddaughter, and prominent figures like Marco Rubio and Elon Musk. Social media buzzed with reactions, with many praising the "iconic" moment.

title: JEE Main 2025 session 2 answer key: Objection window closing today
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) will close the objection window for the JEE Main 2025 Session 2 answer key today, April 13, 2025, at 11:50 PM. Candidates can challenge the provisional answers by visiting jeemain.nta.nic.in, paying a ₹200 non-refundable fee per question. The answer key was released on April 11, 2025, and objections must be submitted through the official portal.

title: Sonu Kakkar announces emotional split from siblings Neha and Tony
content: In an unexpected and emotional social media post, singer Sonu Kakkar declared that she is no longer a sister to her younger siblings, singer Neha Kakkar and music composer Tony Kakkar. The announcement has left fans stunned and has triggered a wave of speculation, especially since it comes shortly after Sonu’s absence from Tony’s birthday celebrations on April 9 — a detail that many had already found curious.

title: A million mark: The number behind Trump's deportation push
content: The Trump administration reportedly aimed for an unprecedented immigration crackdown, targeting up to 1 million deportations within a year, far exceeding previous records. Experts doubt the feasibility due to legal, logistical, and financial hurdles. While the administration ramps up enforcement and negotiates with countries for third-country removals, analysts remain skeptical of achieving the ambitious goal, citing complexities and resource constraints.

title: Walking or exercising on an empty stomach can lead to these 6 dangerous illnesses
content: Exercising or walking is one of the best habits for long-term health, but doing it the wrong way can do more damage than expected. A small, balanced meal or a light snack before a workout helps prepare the body, protects muscle health, and keeps energy levels steady. Choosing the right fuel at the right time is not just about improving performance—it's about protecting the body from illness.

title: Myanmar hit by 5.5 quake weeks after deadly 7.7 temblor
content: A 5.5 magnitude earthquake struck central Myanmar near Meiktila, a region already reeling from a devastating 7.7 magnitude quake in March. While there were no immediate reports of significant damage or casualties, residents fled buildings, and some ceilings were damaged.

title: NIA probes Tahawwur Rana’s links with Dubai-based individual who knew of 2008 Mumbai attack
content: Rana is said to be grilled on the basis of various leads gathered during the course of investigation including a large number of phone calls between him and his co-conspirator David Coleman Headley alias Daood Gilani

title: Centre planning ₹10 lakh crore investment to rewire highways; roads in northeast will be on par with the U.S.: Gadkari
content: There is an urgent need to augment the road infrastructure in the Northeast given its difficult terrain and proximity to borders, Nitin Gadkari said

title: Coimbatore pastor wanted in POCSO case arrested at Munnar
content: Jebaraj is accused of having sexually assaulted two girls aged 17 and 14 at a party at his residence in Coimbatore in May last year

title: Battle against Naxals in its last phase, says Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren
content: Mr. Soren and Governor Santosh Kumar Gangwar paid floral tributes to the mortal remains of Jawan, Sunil Dhan, who lost his life in an IED blast in West Singhbhum district on the previous day

title: Twelve more arrested in violence over Waqf Act in West Bengal's Murshidabad: Police
content: Raids continued overnight, and 12 more people were arrested. With this, 150 people have been arrested so far, a senior police officer said

title: Punish all involved in corrupt liquidation of Assam paper mills: Body of unions
content: A subsidiary of Tata Electronics is building a semiconductor plant on the plot of one of the liquidated units of Hindustan Paper Corporation Limited

title: 21-year-old man arrested for raping, killing girl in Manipur's Churachandpur
content: The girl had gone to the forest to collect firewood. As she did not return, her father went to the forest looking for her. He found her body with clothes torn and injury marks

title: PM Modi, President Murmu pays tribute to Jallianwala Bagh massacre victims
content: We pay homage to the martyrs of Jallianwala Bagh. The coming generations will always remember their indomitable spirit, says PM Narendra Modi

title: Group of people force entry into temple in Madhya Pradesh, thrash priest
content: Group forcibly enters Mata Tekri temple in Dewas, allegedly beats priest; police investigate BJP MLA’s son involvement

title: News in Frames: Tackling a tough track
content: Kolkata, which introduced trams in 1873, has witnessed a sprawling network get reduced to a nostalgic whisper; a petition seeking restoration of services is in court.

title: As malaria cases fall, a look at Tamil Nadu’s strategies for elimination
content: While cases have been falling in T.N., experts warn that cutting back on healthcare workers could be detrimental to the goal of malaria elimination

title: Nine held after stone-pelting during Hanuman Jayanti procession in M.P.’s Guna
content: While the situation is normal now, police personnel have been deployed in heavy numbers across the city

title: Business jet owners wrestle with Adani-owned Mumbai airport over eviction notice
content: Mumbai airport asks them to shift, imposes ₹20 crore parking fee; BAOA says parking is an aeronautical service determined by the tariff regulator

title: Shivraj meets Bihar NDA leaders to plan for upcoming Assembly election
content: After the meeting, Deputy CM Samrat Choudhary said that Nitish Kumar is the leader of NDA and will remain so in future as well.

title: New insemination technology to help boost income of dairy farmers in Andhra Pradesh
content: The Animal Husbandry Department has performed 1,23,677 artificial inseminations and achieved a ratio of female and male calves of 91:9, says Andhra Pradesh Livestock Development Agency CEO

title: AIADMK will not compromise on State’s autonomy: Edappadi Palaniswami counters CM Stalin
content: Stalin was thunderstruck by the announcement of the AIADMK-BJP alliance, and released a statement when his panic was at the peak, Mr. Palaniswami said

title: Andhra Pradesh Govt. sanctions tariff subsidy of ₹4,471 crore to Discoms for Q1 of 2025-26
content: In a G.O. issued to that effect, the officer concerned has been directed to remit the advance claim into the bank accounts of the Discoms

title: Eight workers fell ill due to ammonia gas leak in Nellore
content: All were recovered and discharged on the same day, the company representatives told the TDP leaders who visited the shrimp processing plant in Ananthapuram village of TP Gudur mandal

title: Does Tahawwur Rana have links with Pakistan? | Explained
content: Will his extradition help India find a direct link between Pakistan and the Mumbai 26/11 terror case?

title: Calicut elevated to Archdiocese; Chakkalakal named Archbishop
content: Bishop Varghese Chakkalakal of the Diocese of Calicut will become the first Metropolitan Archbishop of the Archdiocese of Calicut

title: M. A. Baby | Congenial comrade
content: The newly elected General Secretary of the CPI(M) faces the tall task of unifying the fragmented Left, defining his party’s role within the INDIA bloc, and securing victory in Kerala Assembly polls

title: Watch: Who is Sadanand Date, the 26/11 hero now leading the Tahawwur Rana probe? | Pulse Maharashtra
content: From surviving a grenade blast in 26/11 to leading the probe against Tahawwur Rana, Sadanand Date’s journey comes full circle.

title: What has the SC ruled on the T.N. Governor? | Explained
content: Experts told The Hindu that the ruling upholds the principles of federalism and provides Opposition-ruled State governments a clear constitutional remedy against inordinate delays by Governors in granting assent to Bills

title: I will continue to be PMK president: Anbumani Ramadoss
content: Dr. Anbumani underlined that he was formally elected as the PMK president by the party’s general council members on May 28, 2022, in Chennai in the presence of Dr. Ramadoss.

title: Claim of over 50% as non-revenue water dubious: stakeholders
content: DCC raises concerns over the potential handover of KWA assets worth ₹3,000 crore and maintenance expenses of ₹1,000 crore per year

title: Derogatory speech by person holding top position is condemnable, says Governor Ravi; Ponmudy apologises for remarks
content: “I have been in public life for a long time. Yet, there was a momentary lapse on my part. My speech hurt many. I apologise,” said T.N. Minister Ponmudy

title: AWHO willing to bear ‘financial burden’ of demolition and rebuilding of Army towers
content: The Army Welfare Housing Organisation willing to cover full financial burden for Chander Kunj Army twin towers demolition and reconstruction in Kerala

title: MHA likely to file review petition against SC verdict on Governor, President role in assenting to State laws
content: Petition challenging SC verdict being readied; officials claim the judgement paves the way to restore a lapsed Bill; court’s three-month timeline for President, Governor assent must be reconsidered, officials say

title: Russian missile strikes warehouse of Indian pharma firm in Ukraine, says Kyiv's mission in Delhi
content: The mission alleged that Moscow is deliberately targeting Indian businesses, destroying medicines meant for children and the elderly

title: Congress says Ahmedabad resolution a battle cry to defend democracy, asks cadre to take it to every home
content: The party also named 183 observers for Gujarat under the ‘Sangathan Srijan Abhiyan’, a campaign to build its organisation in the State

title: Putting Parandur on the radar
content: Early last week, in-principle approval was granted to Chennai’s second airport at Parandur in Kancheepuram district of Tamil Nadu. The airport will feature three midfield terminals, two parallel runways, and a handling capacity of 100 million passengers a year. Sunitha Sekar does a ground report on the multiple factors that are at play, as a massive infrastructure project gets under way. While the new airport is expected to raise the potential for Chennai, in terms of freight and passenger traffic, there are environmental and social justice concerns too

title: In Karnataka, population data might upset the apple cart of political caste calculations
content: Already contested by the land-owning and politically dominant communities – Veerashaiva-Lingayats and Vokkaligas – the figures would spur them to now mount pressure on the government not to accept the recommendations

title: Deploy Central forces in Murshidabad, says Calcutta HC
content: They should work with West Bengal Police to restore normalcy, says Division Bench after three die in clashes and protests over Waqf law; six companies of BSF have already been deployed

title: BJP holds Mamata Banerjee responsible for “anti-Hindu violence” in West Bengal
content: BJP spokesperson Pradeep Bhandari accused Mamata Banerjee of sending a message to extremist groups in the State that she was “supporting them,” following her opposition to Waqf (Amendment) Act.

title: Centre closely monitoring communal violence in West Bengal: Home Secretary
content: About 800 BSF personnel have been deployed in Murshidabad; Ministry of Home Affairs offers ‘all possible assistance’

title: Madhya Pradesh Police planning polygraph test on ‘fake’ cardiologist in Damoh
content: 2013 FIR against Narendra Yadav in Noida was also for using ‘forged’ documents for a job, say police; has had estranged relations with family since he started studying medicine back in 1991

title: Even the graves of NC leaders are protected by Central forces, says BJP
content: Schools are functional, businesses are thriving, and the people of J&K can feel the positive change, says Opposition leader Sunil Sharma; He accuses the NC leadership of failing to control the violence earlier

title: Mehbooba writes letters to Stalin, Mamata, Siddaramaiah; praises their stand on Waqf Act
content: The PDP chief says the Chief Ministers of T.N., West Bengal and Karnataka have upheld the inclusive and democratic idea of India

title: M.P. to launch new milk production policy on Ambedkar Jayanti, says CM
content: Madhya Pradesh CM Mohan Yadav slammed Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav for saying the BJP is making cowsheds because it likes the ‘stench’

title: Rory seizes Masters lead, but Bryson just 2 back
content: Rory McIlroy will take a two-shot lead into the final round of the Masters, with Bryson DeChambeau hot on his heels after a furious finish Saturday.

title: Vols, Iamaleava split; 'no one bigger' than team
content: Tennessee is moving on from starting quarterback Nico Iamaleava, with sources telling ESPN that his decision to skip Friday's practice was a tipping point.

title: Cubs feast in Dodgers' worst home shutout loss
content: The Cubs pounded 21 hits, including nine for extra bases, and won 16-0 in the Dodgers' worst home shutout loss in franchise history.

title: Fan reaches into Trout's glove to snatch a catch
content: On Saturday in Houston, in the right-field corner of Daikin Park, a fan grabbed the ball out of Mike Trout's glove after the Los Angeles Angels star reached into the right-field stands to make what appeared to be a catch during a 4-1 win over the Astros.

title: Western Michigan tops BU, nets Frozen Four title
content: Owen Michaels scored two third-period goals, helping Western Michigan to secure its first Frozen Four championship in a 6-2 victory over Boston University Saturday night, a crowning achievement for a proud program that has been in existence for 52 years.

title: Volkanovski wins vacant title in slugfest with Lopes
content: Alexander Volkanovski proved he's still a force, outslugging Diego Lopes to win the vacant featherweight title Saturday night at UFC 314.

title: Masterful win: Son of ex-PGAer gets 1st MLB win
content: Tigers pitching prospect Jackson Jobe, the son of former pro golfer Brandt Jobe, earned his first major league win on Masters weekend.

title: Source: Utd's Onana dropped for Newcastle clash
content: André Onana has been left out of Manchester United's Premier League clash with Newcastle on Sunday, a source has told ESPN, following heavy criticism of performance against Lyon.

title: Everything at stake on the final day of the NBA regular season
content: The East bracket is set. The West's ... is not. Meanwhile, lottery races across the league will be decided Sunday.

title: NBA postseason tracker: Eastern Conference playoffs set
content: Tracking which teams have clinched for the playoffs with the 2024-25 NBA regular season nearing its conclusion.

title: The draft's biggest risers: Seven players who have boosted their stock since last summer
content: Kyle Williams and Darien Porter are among the 2025 prospects who have improved their draft status this year.

title: Projecting WNBA draft 1st round: Bueckers still No. 1 as Malonga rises; Van Lith, Prince out
content: The No. 2 pick sees an international entry, while Hailey Van Lith and Sedona Prince drop out of the first round.

title: 'Bryson's in the backyard': A Masters contender comes to visit
content: Before Bryson DeChambeau shot a Saturday 69 to get himself into contention, he was putting in work on a stranger's putting green.

title: Power Rankings: Predictions for 2025-26 contention status
content: From top Cup contenders to teams on the bubble to those still building, here's the "next year now" for all 32.

title: Tamil Nadu Governor In Fresh Controversy Over "Jai Shri Ram" Slogan
content: Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi, chastened by the Supreme Court for holding up 10 bills for over three years, has now landed in a fresh row, after allegedly asking students at a function to chant "Jai Shri Ram" at a function.

title: "Leave Now...": A 30-Day Warning For Foreign Nationals Staying In US
content: Foreign nationals who stay in the US longer than 30 days must register with the government and a failure to comply can lead to fines and imprisonment, the Department of Homeland Security under the Donald Trump administration has said.

title: US Visa Bulletin For May 2025 Brings Bad News For Indians
content: Amid US President Donald Trump's immigration crackdown, the American dream of thousands of Indians seems to be fading.

title: Man Attacks Wife With Screwdriver For Giving Birth To Girl In Uttarakhand
content: A woman in Uttarakhand was attacked by her husband with a screwdriver after she gave birth to a girl, the victim's family alleged. The police have filed a case and arrested the accused.

title: 150 Arrested In Bengal, BJP Alleges Hindus Fleeing Home After Waqf Violence
content: Several areas in north Bengal's Murshidabad district are tense in the aftermath of violence during protests against the Waqf Amendment Act. Three people have been killed and 150 arrested in connection with the violence so far.

title: Pastor John Jebaraj Arrested In Kerala For Sexually Assaulting Minors
content: Thirty-seven-year-old Jebaraj, who has a large social media following, had been evading arrest for months.

title: Tahawwur Rana Cited 33 Health Reasons To Stop Extradition. Then US Said This
content: Tahawwur Rana landed in Delhi on Thursday and has been sent to the custody of the anti-terror National Investigation Agency (NIA) for 18 days.

title: IPL LIVE: Virat Handed Lifeline As Parag Drops Catch; RCB Star Slams 50
content: Rajasthan Royals vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru LIVE Score, IPL 2025: Phil Salt smashed a 28-ball fifty and Virat Kohli was dropped by Riyan Parag as RCB chased 174 vs RR in Jaipur.

title: Video: At This Manipur School, Classrooms With Car-Sized Holes
content: A school founded in 1959 at a remote village in Manipur's Ukhrul district which propelled hundreds of students to success in higher studies and finding a career has been left to decay today, local residents said.

title: "Tax On Americans": China's Message To US Citizens Amid Trump's Tariff War
content: Amid the escalating trade war between the United States and China, Beijing seems to have altered its strategy of dealing with Washington by aiming its message directly at the American public instead of the Trump administration.

title: Pet Pit Bull Kills 7-Month-Old US Girl, Mother Says "Won't Understand Why"
content: Grieving parents of a 7-month-old baby girl who was fatally attacked by one of the family's pit bulls have shared tributes online, expressing shock and sorrow over the incident.

title: "Visiting America Is Not...": Top US Diplomat Defends Trump's Visa Policy
content: Since coming to power in January, Donald Trump has deported some foreign students, has revoked multiple visas and has warned universities of federal funding cuts over pro-Palestinian protests.

title: Bangladesh Court Issues Arrest Warrant Against Sheikh Hasina In Graft Case
content: A court in Bangladesh issued arrest warrants against ousted prime minister Sheikh Hasina, her sister Sheikh Rehana, British MP Tulip Rizwana Siddiq, and 50 others in connection with the alleged illegal acquisition of land by abusing political power.

title: UP Woman Forced To Drink Alcohol, Strangled, Then Burnt Over Property Row
content: The body of Anjali, who had been missing for five days, was recovered in a mutilated state on Saturday near a river in Etawah.

title: How Insects, Smallest Animals Survive Antarctica
content: In Antarctica's freezing depths, tiny creatures have mastered survival tactics that could unlock secrets to extreme cold resistance, with implications for science and medicine.

title: Reports: USMNT's McKennie in gambling probe
content: United States midfielder Weston McKennie is among 13 soccer players being investigated for illegal online betting in Italy, according to widespread media reports.

title: Martinelli: Nørgaard 'could have broken my leg'
content: Arsenal winger Gabriel Martinelli has said Christian Nørgaard "could have broken my leg" and should have been sent off for a late tackle in Saturday's 1-1 draw with Brentford.

title: Austin GK catches mouse on field during game
content: An unexpected visitor briefly interrupted Saturday's MLS encounter between the Vancouver Whitecaps and Austin FC, when a mouse had to be rescued from the field at BC Place.

title: Martínez tackle 'like a goal' as Barça close on title
content: Hansi Flick celebrated Iñigo Martínez's incredible stoppage-time tackle as if it was a goal as Barcelona took another step towards the LaLiga titl.

title: USMNT striker White scores 4 in Whitecaps rout
content: USMNT striker Brian White scored a franchise-record four goals and became the first player in Whitecaps history to score 50 career regular-season goals as Vancouver beat Austin FC 5-1.

title: Bayern held by Dortmund to keep title race alive
content: Borussia Dortmund prevented Bayern Munich from going eight points clear in the Bundesliga on Saturday by fighting back for a 2-2 draw in "der Klassiker."

title: Ronaldo nets stunning volley to hand Al Nassr win
content: Cristiano Ronaldo scored twice, including a stunning volleyed effort, to give Al Nassr a come-from-behind win over the visiting Al Riyadh in the Saudi Pro League on Saturday.

title: Hamilton 'sorry' as Ferrari struggles continue
content: Lewis Hamilton was dejected after qualifying ninth, saying "it's definitely not a good feeling for sure."

title: Why Sedona Prince is the toughest WNBA draft prospect to evaluate
content: She's a skilled 6-7 center, but some GMs have expressed doubt about drafting Sedona Prince after accusations of intimate partner violence.

title: 'An ordinary guy': What's John Daly doing at the Hooters in Augusta?
content: Daly hasn't played the Masters since 2006, but every year he shows up in town to hang and sell merch.

title: Malik Beasley disagrees with Giannis Antetokounmpo's shimmy after late-game block
content: The Pistons guard took his frustration to social media after the Bucks forward performed his signature celebration.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eyeing move for Cherki
content: Man United are reportedly looking at a possible deal to sign Lyon's Rayan Cherki. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

content: amateurism, at least in college athletics, is a good settlement . it will soon open the door for college athletic departments to pay athletes directly with revenue gleaned from media rights, tickets, sponsorships and so on . many think it's what many think should have happened generations ago . this would be official death certificate, though .

title: Man City's assist kings keep rolling vs. Palace
content: Kevin de Bruyne has revealed he will leave manchester city in the summer . if both players depart the Etihad, city will be losing two of their best assist providers . the midfielder has seven assists from 272 games in his career to date .

title: Stanley Cup playoff watch: What's at stake in Sunday's games
content: the 11 NHL games on Saturday helped solidify the playoff picture . three teams (the Detroit Red Wings , New York Rangers and New York Islanders ) have been eliminated from the race . the St. Louis Blues lost in the shootout to the Seattle Kraken .

title: Rory vs. Bryson: What to expect from an epic Sunday showdown at the Masters
content: Rory McIlroy moves one stroke ahead as he chips in for eagle on the 15th hole at augusta national . the two-time U.S. Open winner is 12 under par and five shots ahead of Bryson deChambeau . he had landed his second shot like a feather and left himself a mere 6 feet for the ball .
